result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew L Schucknecht was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment or pursue schooling.
Defendant shall not consume any illegal substances, absent valid prescriptions authorized by healthcare provider.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Provide biological specimen to State Crime Lab for DNA analysis.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew L Schucknecht
